Reviews.Title: “Just not good enough”
Reviews.Author: 5_O
Reviews.Content: Spend 2 nights here for business reasons and mainly chose it for its location. As you can see from previous reviews this is quite a new hotel and a dry one which isn't an issue with me. Here are my thoughts Pros Located right outside is the Emirate Towers Metro Station. Cons 1) Hard to find for Taxi drivers. (this will probably improve over time and more drivers start to know its location) 2) Poor furnitures. as mentioned before some of the furnitures are old and in poor condition, clearly taken from another hotel. 3) very poor fittings, the wash basin was loose and was moving around during use and on the last night of use the whole sink drain trap detached and waste water flowed onto the floor. 4) No hot water! - called maintainance and observed what he did to solve it. Basically all the taps to full for hot water and wait for 10 mins before there was any. 5) The elevators was very loud and can be heard from quite far away 6) Breakfast was on the 5th floor Metro restaurant, average food and slow service 7) The staff was friendly enough but the valet didn't speak very good english and when i asked for a card to show taxi drivers i was basically asked to go myself to the front desk to get it. 8) WIFI was slow and kept dropping. 9) The front desk upon checking out asked if there was any issues and when i mentioned the above issues ie wash basin, hot water and furniture the reply was like "oh ok we know about these issues" No apologies nor solutions was offered, why did you bothered to ask in the first place. A poor experience of this hotel and there is plently of choice in Dubai, will not be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay”
Reviews.Author: Robin380
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 7 nights in early February and early March 2012. On 4th Febraury we arrived at 7 am in the morning. As check in was later in the day, the duty manager, Arun Pillai made every effort to get a room for us and he did so and even upgraded us to a club room. Mr. A run was excellent is his service, professionalism and kindness. I must also make special mention of Chiarra at reception, who was very kind and provided an excellent service. The room was good on a high floor overlooking the city, and our return we had a same room but overlooking the sea. Breakfast had a good mix of food though the staff did not offer us tea or coffee unless we requested it.. Found the seating area in the Lobby area very limited and on many occasions we had no where to sit. The location of the hotel is excellent, right in front of the Emirates Towers station and very close to Dubai Mall, Burg Kalifa etc. Taxis found it difficult to find the new hotel, especially since the front entrance is hidden behind the entrance to the train station and the hotel sugars is not clearly visible from the road. The hotel provided good value for money but may not suit guests who require liquor as it is "dry". Generally good overall.

Reviews.Title: “City hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sjr_1972
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large, spacious and very clean however in order to get hot water I had to run all the taps for 10 minutes which seemed incredibly wasteful. The breakfast was excellent with plenty choice, we also enjoyed a buffet lunch at the hotel. It is a 'dry' hotel but the Crowne Plaza is only 4-5 minutes walk away if you are in desperate need of a G&T. The metro is right outside the property with easy access to the airport, malls etc. The pool area is nice but as a female lone traveller I did not feel particularly comfortable walking over to the multi storey car park to access it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experiance”
Reviews.Author: mbinyahya
Reviews.Content: Very good Hotel ... and recommended to stay in... staff are friendly and supportive... location is great ... rooms are clean and nice

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but much to learn.”
Reviews.Author: markvip
Reviews.Content: So I stayed here during it's soft opening period in January 2012 and had a very challenging experience. Firstly, on checking in at 2pm following a very delayed flight due to fog, I was told my room wasnt ready - and wouldnt be for 4 HOURS because they hadnt finsihes cleaning the rooms yet. I stamped my feet a little and managed to get a room after 45 minutes, but this didnt bode well. The room was terrific; I'll concede that. And spacious. The bathroom overlooking the room is unusual and quirky which suited me. The work area was terrific too. However the wiFi didnt work for most of my stay, or when it did it was incredibly slow. We held a conference in the property at the same time, and the conference facilities were definately a concern. There was constant drilling for 2 of our 4 day conference. Not a great advert in a room full of travel agents from all over EMEA. A young chap named John though, who works within the Conference & Banquesting team was a real star and a shining example of service. He should be commended. During the event we learned that a number of our guests were outbooked to another property due to some "operational problems," Finally on check out, the entire events charges were levied against my room bill, strictly against the arrangements made. While all of these were teething problems, first impressions count. Would I go back, yes, but not for some time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff, Poor Breakfast, Average Atmosphere, Just like 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Omidgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 3 days in last days of Feb together with a couple of freinds. We were happy about the rooms, their spectacular view and cleaning. The lift was very efficient as well. Unfortunately we did not have enough time to try pool, Gym and SPA. The staff were always very nice and polite, specially "Front Office Manager", Mr. Sandeep Sharma, who is a very smart person to manage this position. I reserved my room location according to my priority 3 days before by his paying attention. I regret to say that the breakfast was not good at all. It was the worst breakfast in 5 star or even 4 star hotels I have ever seen. Also, Furniture is not as new as the hotel. Lobby is very small but the hotel is well located just beside the metro station (Emirates Tower Station) so you can reach to the airport in 20 minutes easily without any stress (Sheikh Zaied Road has a awesome traffic in the morning).

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel no bars?”
Reviews.Author: gieorgeyoung
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights here from the 2nd to 5th February. Beware the taxis cant find the place, Ask reception for a location map when you arrive. Also request a non smoking room Reception dont offer. We had to change rooms The hotel is dry so we ate out as there was nothing to keep us in the hotel. We complained to travel agent when we got home they were surprised that a five star hotel could be dry and have apologised This was not a good time to visit it was a prophets birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: SinnedEsbjerg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days beginning of february together with a couple of freinds. We decided to stay 3 in each room to get a bigger room. The room was ok and the view nice- But the rooms wasn't very big and sure not big enough for 3 persons. The extra bed which was just a folding bed, was very hard and uncomfortable. ( I am just happy I didn't pick the smallets straw ) The breakfast was ok but I have a better on a lot of other hotels. This is a dry hotel - so no alcohol ! - which is I guess is ok as you can go elsewhere. But as a thirsty Scandinavian I just find it strange that you got a hotel with No bar. It took us about 45 min to check in and about an hour to check out. Upon the check in - the hotel wanted a deposit on dirham 1500 ? which I had problems getting back on the check out because I have lost the reciept. The last day we had a late flght back and decided to ask for a late check out and keep the room for the rest of the day. We got a price from the reception the day before leaving which we accepted. But at noon the following day ( which is the normal chack out ) We got a call from the reception that the rate was extra 200 dirham on top on the rate given the day before. I guess the price would have been ok if we have got the exact rate from the beginning. But this surely pissed me of- so we decided to pack in a hurry ( which ofcourse was very annoying ) as we was on the way out. We got packed and then used an hour to check out- So 2 hours wasted mid day because the hotel didn't knew their own rates. The hotel is well loacated, nice pool area( but small ) I guess in total the hotel is ok, if it was rated a 3 star, we just had an bad experience. Would not go back and it's difinitely not a five Star.. who makes these stars ? The hotels themselves ?

Reviews.Title: “New hotel but old ideals”
Reviews.Author: pompeyblue
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights on possibly good rate (B&B £570 from 30/1) n 34th Floor to watch England/Pakistan Cricket. Although opened December 2011 the staff & Decor appear fed up already. Furniture in room appeared from previous usage. The safe did not work & free parking to Garage was a nightmare.You were let in one day & then barred the next. It appeared you had to pay the valet parking or they would not let you in. 5 Star with paper napkins & every thing including juice, food seem to be done on the cheap. No bar or helpfulness from staff. As staying 8 days asked to be transferred to other Millenium Hotel in Dubai om day 3 & was told Manager would contact me which never materialised after countless requests.Only plus is it is nect to the very effective Metro.Would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: cristina_ceara
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well positioned..with metro station in front of the hotel.we stayed at the 38 floor, the view is incredible;the room is nice but not large enough-i stayed at 3 stars hotel with rooms larger than this..the bathroom has a glass wall with a view of sheik zayed rd-the cons were-although is a 5 star hotel they didn t provide bathrobes; i had to call 3 times before they brang me a shaving kit and after the 2 nights the shower gel finished and i had to call 3 times before they brang it.they are very polite when i call reception but they are very slow in delivering.i paid 20 dhm for 1 h internet but it worked 15 minutes and very slow.the difference in price between millenium plaza and fairmont was very little but fairmont is a 5 star hotel with quality services.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid...”
Reviews.Author: akrulz
Reviews.Content: Please avoid, the staff doesn't listen to your requirements. Was there from 18-22 Jan 2012, Never again

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mgreg
Reviews.Content: I`ve stayed 3 nights in this new hotel. It` s more like a 64 floors hotel for business travellers, brand new, rooms from 26 to 64 floors. Good service, average breakfast, pretty good choice of food on the restaurant on the 5th floor. From the same floor you can reach the open air pool by crossing a bridge to the parking building in the back and by taking there the elevator to the top, where the pool is. I had a superior room, good in size, excellent big bathroom with bathtube and separate shower with rain shower. Very comfortable bed, clean room, daily cleaning of room. A litlle overpriced regarding the cloth washing. Nice staff, good service, reception staff a little slow. Even slower is the internet, chargeable, 20Dhs/h. I don`t get it. Why you have to pay for that? They don`t serve alcohol in hotel premises but you can easily find it on the bars and hotels nearby. For a 64 storey hotel, the elevators served pretty well, they also have shuttle bus in the morning to the Jumeirah beach and Dubai Mall which is 2 metro stations away. The Metro station is right in front of the hotel so you have easy access to transportation. Taxies are cheap, but drivers don`t know the location, there is another Millenium Hotel(Grand) but elswhere, so you can use Emirates Towers Metro Station or Crowne Plaza for reference. Overall a pleasant stay, kind of boring if you stay inside. Good hotel, but there` s a feeling something`s missing.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent hotel at an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ADRAS
Reviews.Content: this is probably the newest hotel in Dubai since it opens on the 15 /12 /2011. we stayed there from 30/12 /2011 - 6/1/2012. although there were some problems during our checking in (it took them almost 2 hours to give us the key to our room ) , the hotel in general is very good., clean,with helpful and polite stuff and located near the metro station .. i would recommend this hotel to every Dubai visitor.

HotelInfo.Name: Millennium Plaza Hotel Dubai
HotelInfo.Address: Sheikh Zayed Road, Dubai 191055, United Arab Emirates
